verbs.description: outstatistic (third-person singular simple present outstatistics, present participle outstatisticking, simple past and past participle outstatisticked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To look better, or more impressive, when described using statistics.
examples: We outstatisticked the Crusaders but could not capitalize on scoring chances.

entries.meaning: To use statistics to win an argument.
examples: We need someone who can outstatistic the highway department experts.

entries.meaning: To know or give more statistics about a specified topic.
